memberdef.argsstring: (snd_timer_query_t **timer, const char *name, snd_config_t *timer_root, snd_config_t *timer_conf, int mode)
memberdef.name: snd_timer_query_open_conf

briefdescription.para: Opens a new connection to the timer query interface.

detaileddescription.para:
timer
Returned handle (NULL if not wanted)
name
ASCII identifier of the RawMidi handle
mode
Open mode
0 on success otherwise a negative error code Opens a new connection to the RawMidi interface specified with an ASCII identifier and mode.

briefdescription.para: Opens a new connection to the timer query interface using local configuration.

detaileddescription.para:
timer
Returned handle (NULL if not wanted)
name
ASCII identifier of the RawMidi handle
mode
Open mode
lconf
Local configuration
0 on success otherwise a negative error code Opens a new connection to the RawMidi interface specified with an ASCII identifier and mode.

timer
timer handle
0 on success otherwise a negative error code Closes the specified timer handle and frees all associated resources.

timer
timer handle
tid
timer identification
0 on success otherwise a negative error code if tid->dev_class is -1, then the first device is returned if result tid->dev_class is -1, no more devices are left

briefdescription.para: get size of the snd_timer_ginfo_t structure in bytes

simplesect.para: size of the snd_timer_ginfo_t structure in bytes

detaileddescription.para:
info
returned pointer
0 on success otherwise a negative error code if fails Allocates a new snd_timer_info_t structure using the standard malloc C library function.

info
pointer to the snd_timer_ginfo_t structure to free
Frees the given snd_timer_info_t structure using the standard free C library function.

briefdescription.para: copy one snd_timer_info_t structure to another

simplesect.para: zero on success otherwise a negative error number

briefdescription.para: get timer minimal resolution in ns
get timer maximal resolution in ns

0 on success otherwise a negative error code

detaileddescription.para:
info
returned pointer
0 on success otherwise a negative error code if fails Allocates a new snd_timer_id_t structure using the standard malloc C library function.

info

briefdescription.para: copy one snd_timer_id_t structure to another

Jaroslav Kysela perex@perex.cz
2001 Timer Query Interface is designed to obtain identification of timers.
